properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 11:44AM CST until January 12 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
...Periods of Wintry Precipitation, Possibly Significant, Tonight
Through Saturday Night...

* WHAT...Rain is likely to change over to a period of light
freezing rain and sleet very late tonight into Saturday morning.
Total ice accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch are
likely late tonight into Saturday morning, with some sleet
accumulation also possible. While precipitation may lighten in
intensity Saturday late morning through mid afternoon, a period
of snow is likely Saturday evening. Total snow accumulations of
2 to 4 inches are possible. Northeast winds will gust as high
as 45 mph overnight into Saturday and combined with ice and snow
may cause further impacts.

* WHERE...Lake IL and Kane Counties.

* WHEN...From 3 AM Saturday to 3 AM CST Sunday.

* Travel could become impacted at times very late tonight into
Saturday, and then again later Saturday afternoon into Saturday
night. Some power outages and tree damage are possible due to
the combination of ice and wind. Patchy blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility later Saturday afternoon and
night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. The latest road
conditions for Indiana are available by calling 18002617623.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SATURDAY TO 3 AM CST SUNDAY
